verses.verse: (Punishment for Israel’s Sin) (Isa 22.12, 13; Jer 44.17; Hos 4.12; 10.5) Do not rejoice, O Israel! Do not exult (Gk: Heb To exultation) as other nations do, for you have prostituted yourself, departing from your God. You have loved a prostitute’s pay on all threshing floors.
(Hos 2.9) Threshing floor and wine vat shall not feed them, and the new wine shall fail them.
(Jer 2.7; Ezek 4.13; Hos 7.11; 8.13) They shall not remain in the land of the LORD, but Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and in Assyria they shall eat unclean food.

(Jer 6.20; Hos 5.6; 8.13; Hag 2.14) They shall not pour drink offerings of wine to the LORD, and their sacrifices shall not please him. Such sacrifices shall be like mourners’ bread; all who eat of it shall be defiled, for their bread shall be for their hunger only; it shall not come to the house of the LORD.
(Isa 10.3; Jer 5.31; Joel 1.13) What will you do on the day of appointed festival and on the day of the festival of the LORD?

(Isa 5.6; Jer 2.16; Ezek 30.13, 16; Hos 8.13; 10.8) For even if they escape destruction, Egypt shall gather them; Memphis shall bury them. Nettles shall possess their precious things of silver; (Meaning of Heb uncertain) thorns shall be in their tents.

(Isa 34.8; Jer 10.15; 16.18; Ezek 14.9, 10; Mic 7.4) The days of punishment have come; the days of recompense have come. Israel will cry out, (Or will know) “The prophet is a fool; the man of the spirit is mad!” Because of your great iniquity, your hostility is great.
(Hos 5.1) The prophet is a sentinel for my God over Ephraim, yet a hunter’s snare is on all his ways and hostility in the house of his God.
(Judg 19.12; Isa 31.6; Hos 5.8; 7.2; 8.13; 10.9) They have deeply corrupted themselves as in the days of Gibeah; he will remember their iniquity; he will punish their sins.

(Num 25.3; Jer 11.13; 24.2; Hos 4.14; Mic 7.1) Like grapes in the wilderness, I found Israel. Like the first fruit on the fig tree, in its first season, I saw your ancestors. But they came to Baal-peor and consecrated themselves to a thing of shame and became detestable like the thing they loved.
(v 14|HOS 9:14; Hos 4.7; 10.5) Ephraim’s glory shall fly away like a bird— no birth, no pregnancy, no conception!
(v 16|HOS 9:16; Hos 7.13) Even if they bring up children, I will bereave them until no one is left. Woe to them indeed when I depart from them!
(Ezek 27.3, 4) Once I saw Ephraim as a young palm planted in a lovely meadow, (Meaning of Heb uncertain) but now Ephraim must lead out his children for slaughter.
Give them, O LORD— what will you give? Give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.

(Isa 1.23; Hos 4.9; 7.2; 12.2) Every evil of theirs began at Gilgal; there I came to hate them. Because of the wickedness of their deeds I will drive them out of my house. I will love them no more; all their officials are rebels.
(v 12|HOS 9:12; Hos 5.11; 8.7) Ephraim is stricken, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit. Even though they give birth, I will kill the cherished offspring of their womb.
(Deut 28.65; Hos 4.10) Because they have not listened to him, my God will reject them; they shall become wanderers among the nations.
